stream_context.summary: Kaze focuses on Course 11’s underground section ("Oily Boily Bay – OBB Underground"). He fixes recently-introduced bugs, refines geometry, adds new sliding entrance, hydraulic piston platforms, railings, an oil-hazard plan, and tweaks the Chomp enemy. Texture/memory optimisation and object behaviour coding dominate the session.

development_findings.summary: Game now ~75-80 % complete: 11 of 15 courses are playable; much early engine work is already done.
development_findings.quote: It's only one fifth done. This is course 11 and there's 15 courses, so we are at least two thirds done.

development_findings.summary: Kaze meets self-imposed daily deadlines (14 days straight); current sprint: bug fixes plus block-out of OBB underground.
development_findings.quote: I've done this for 14 days now and so far I hit every single deadline.

development_findings.summary: OBB underground redesign: entrance becomes a short slide that dumps Mario into the machinery area.
Introduced hydraulic piston platforms with variable speed and asynchronous rhythms (Bparam system: pause, speed, duration).
development_findings.quote: I want variable speed here… I don't want the rhythm to sync up at all.

development_findings.summary: Added railings, expanded climb routes, and relocated Yoshi Coin (#4) for clearer navigation and challenge balance.
Oil hazard planned: reflective black ‘boiling tar’ water that Mario can surf but is hard to exit; will include bubbling vertex animation and smoke particles.
development_findings.quote: Very reflective black tar… bubbles and some smoke. Mario goes ha-ha-ha-ha.

development_findings.summary: New ‘oil puddle’ enemy concept inspired by 3D World ‘blot’ enemies; not yet coded.
Chompy enemy given HD model + two new action states; 1/16 chance to trigger; demo video likely for main channel.
development_findings.quote: He has a new model too—he looks so HD now.

development_findings.summary: Warp objects in RTYI have two extra parameters (warp height hitbox and exit camera angle), requiring re-authoring imported levels.
development_findings.quote: Warps in RTYI have two additional parameters… if you don't have one of them you will [break things].

development_findings.summary: N64 texture limits (4 KB per segment) force unconventional sizes (e.g., 96 × 42 I4) and re-using textures; PC port deemed unrealistic, but full source will be published.
development_findings.quote: I seriously doubt anyone is gonna have the skill to make a PC port of this… but I will make a public source.

development_findings.summary: Engine roadmap: 30 FPS ‘lag’ bug under investigation; plan to merge render & gameplay threads in 30 FPS mode.
development_findings.quote: If you are in 30 FPS mode… the gameplay thread becomes part of the rendering thread—that will allow us to increase the FPS.

development_findings.summary: Open-sourcing engine expected to let other ROM-hackers switch to it after release.
development_findings.quote: I think a good bunch of them will switch to my engine.

context_findings.summary: Kaze dislikes modern ‘time-wasting’ game design; aims for meaningful, challenging experiences.
context_findings.quote: Modern game design is made for people that are depressed and just want to erase time—not for people that want to have an experience.

context_findings.summary: He recently started full-time work at Gears for Breakfast; balances job, YouTube, and hack development.
context_findings.quote: Keep in mind… that I did get a full-time job, like, recently.

context_findings.summary: Uses second YouTube channel (Kaze Clips) for low-effort uploads; main channel reserved for ‘important’ content to avoid viewer fatigue.
context_findings.quote: On the main channel I only want to post when I actually have something important.

context_findings.summary: Financial note: Christmas ad-revenue and potential Honkai Star Rail sponsorship (~$3-4k) seen as funding sources for team.
context_findings.quote: Around Christmas… you just get a 50 % pay raise… Honkai Star Rail… I feel like $3,000, $4,000 is a possibility.

context_findings.summary: Personal morale: proud of progress, annoyed by constant release-date questions; light-hearted but frustrated running joke that contributor Leela ‘died’.
context_findings.quote: Please don't spend the whole stream asking me for a release date again—that was miserable.

biobak.summary: Supplied high-res sail model/texture; collaborates with Kaze to compress it into 4 KB N64 limit (proposed 96 × 42 I4 workaround).
biobak.quote: Does this work for you, Biobak? This is the most cursed texture resolution I've ever seen.

biobak.summary: Will send Blender file of sail; helps choose Yoshi Coin colours and general texturing advice.

badub.summary: Music rights: Kaze plans to pay the composer to release soundtrack as a ROM-based album on N64 cartridge.
badub.quote: When RTYI releases, I want to pay the musician to have the rights to the music and then release an album.

zeina.summary: Active in chat; recalls lost ‘Hot Tub Mario’ mod and supports sponsorship gag ideas.

key_stories.title: Hydraulic Platform Breakthrough
key_stories.summary: Kaze wanted the oil-rig interior to feel alive and improve vertical navigation. He devised piston-like platforms with variable speed and randomised timing.
key_stories.challenge: Static geometry felt dull and climbing was tedious.
key_stories.process: Parameterized an existing up-down platform behaviour (Bparam1 pause, Bparam2 duration/4, Bparam3 speed), ensured asynchronous movement, solved update-order and culling bugs.
key_stories.outcome: Visually dynamic machinery area; player can reach higher zones intuitively; Kaze satisfied with new ‘Pistonville’ vibe.
key_stories.key_quote: This is going to be Pistonville… it's going to make platforming a bit more fun.

key_stories.title: Fitting the Sail Texture
key_stories.summary: Biobak’s detailed sail exceeded N64 VRAM. Kaze and Biobak experimented with non-standard resolutions to squeeze it in.
key_stories.challenge: Sail texture plus other assets overflowed 4096-byte segment.
key_stories.process: Discussed I4 format, attempted combinating textures, calculated divisors, settled on 96 × 42 resolution; will N64-verify.
key_stories.outcome: Texture now tentatively fits; needs final hardware test.

key_stories.title: Oil Hazard Visual Concept
key_stories.summary: OBB underground needs a boiling oil pit that functions like water but looks dangerous.
key_stories.challenge: Unsure how ‘boiling oil’ should appear on N64 hardware.
key_stories.process: Researched boiling tar/chocolate references; decided on highly reflective black surface, vertex-animated bubbles, optional smoke; will allow surfing but tricky exit.
key_stories.outcome: Visual plan logged; to be implemented next stream.
key_stories.key_quote: Very reflective black tar… bubbles and some smoke.
